metadata.title: CVE-2024-26911 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/buddy: Fix alloc_range() error handling code Few users have observeddisplay corruption when they boot the machine to KDE Plasma or playinggames. We have root caused the problem that whenever alloc_range() couldn'tfind the required memory blocks the function was returning SUCCESS in someof the corner cases. The right approach would be if the total allocatedsize is less than the required size, the function should return -ENOSPC.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
